properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 2:27PM PST until January 17 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...None.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6
inches east of Highway 395, 5 to 10 inches west of Highway 395
and 12-20 inches along the Sierra crest. Winds gusting as high
as 55 mph with ridge wind gusts to 100 mph.

* WHERE...Mono County.

* WHEN...From noon Thursday to 1 AM PST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Very strong winds
could cause tree damage and periods of white out conditions.
properties.instruction:
Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for
many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry
an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay
home, have a backup plan in case of power outages.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO 1 AM PST FRIDAY
